item.description:
Come celebrate Samhain with us and remember those who have passed on, and honor those who died during the burning times.....

Activities will include: Samhain Ritual, Rememberence of real people convicted of Witchcraft during the burning times, potluck feast, costume contest, pumpkin carving contest, and huge bonfire with chanting and drumming.

Awesome pagan prizes for the best pagan costume, and the best carved pumpkin-

(you may take your pumpkins home for Halloween :)

SOME IMPORTANT INFORMATION:

-Please bring a $5.00 donation (to cover ritual materials, prizes, and paper products) as well as something for our pot luck dinner. Please bring your own alcohol. All paper products will be provided.

-You may dress comfortably, or choose to participate in our adult or child costume contest- There will be prizes for the best adult and best child costume. If you are planning on attending with your children young children, please email me at: talawolf7@webtv.net with how many children (boy or girls) so that I can have enough candy gift bags for all the kids.

-We will also be having an adult and child pumpkin carving contest. Please bring your Pre-carved pumpkin to enter for great prizes, which you may also bring home for your Halloween or Samhain celebrations.

-We will be doing an "Altar for the Dead" and a silent supper, so if you would like, you can bring your pictures or momentos to put on the altar which will also return home with you after the celebration.

-We will be offering a Dedication during this years Samhain Ceremony for anyone who would like to formally dedicated to the path. It is a short and simple ceremony, that one needs NO prior preparation for.

 

Schedule of Events will be as follows:                                                                               (Please note this is subject to minor changes)

4:00- 5:00 Meet & Greet- Appetizers

5:00- 5:30 Pre-Ritual Talk and Preparation

5:30- 6:30 Samhain Ritual & Dedication Ceremony

6:30 Spiral Candle Procession

7:00 Silent Supper & Pot Luck Feast

8:00 Costume, Pumpkin Carving, and Halloween Trivia Contests & Prizes

9:00 Desserts

        Bonfire & Burning of the Wicker Man

10:00 Witch Dance (come watch or participate!!)
item.how_to_find_us: Park across the Street at Martin Tool- the house is red with a wolf mailbox and fence in front :)
item.why: We put on awesome open celebrations! :)
item.name: Open Samhain Celebration
